For more information, you can read Executive Summary 10- DSA-1671   OVAL : Open Vulnerability and Assessment Language CWE : Common Weakness Enumeration CAPEC : Common Pattern Enumeration CVE : Common Vulnerability Enumeration Contacts About us About US Blog CVSS Calculator OVAL Definitions OVAL Repository CPE : Common Plateform Enumeration DPE : Default Password Enumeration CAPEC : Common Pattern Enumeration CWE : Common Weakness Enumeration vDNA : Vulnerability DNA API Documentation vDNA : Vulnerability DNA API Resources HP VMware US-CERT Gentoo
textAfterTable: Title: Mozilla Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.18, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.13 do not properly change the source URI when processing a canvas element and an HTTP redirect, which allows remote attackers to bypass the same origin policy and access arbitrary images that are not directly accessible to the attacker. NOTE: this issue can be leveraged to enumerate software on the client by performing redirections related to moz-icon. Description: Mozilla Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.18, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.13 do not properly change the source URI when processing a canvas element and an HTTP redirect, which allows remote attackers to bypass the same origin policy and access arbitrary images that are not directly accessible to the attacker. NOTE: this issue can be leveraged to enumerate software on the client by performing redirections related to moz-icon. Family: unix Class: vulnerability Reference(s): CVE-2008-5012 Version: 5 Platform(s): Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3 CentOS Linux 3 Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 CentOS Linux 4 Oracle Linux 4 Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 CentOS Linux 5 Oracle Linux 5 Product(s): Definition Synopsis:
